headline: Sable Seeks CA Approval to Restart Las Flores Oil Flows
summary: Sable warned it would opt to divert oil flows outside California if delays continue.

headline: Exxon Mobil (XOM) Valuation in Focus After Global Workforce Restructuring and Efficiency Push
summary: Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) shares have been in focus after the company revealed plans to cut around 2,000 jobs worldwide, or 3% to 4% of its global workforce. This move is part of a strategy to consolidate offices and drive efficiencies in response to changing industry conditions. See our latest analysis for Exxon Mobil. Exxon Mobil’s recent workforce reductions cap off a flurry of strategic moves, from consolidating regional offices to evaluating non-core asset sales and advancing major projects...

headline: Exxon Mobil's Future Is Not Priced In Yet, Buy Ahead Of Q3
summary: Exxon Mobil offers 25% upside with breakthrough Permian tech, strong cash flow, and Guyana-led growth, trading well below fair value. See why XOM stock is a buy.

headline: Exxon CEO Warns EU’s CSDDD Would Cripple Business
summary: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods has sharply criticized the EU’s Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive, warning it would impose unworkable costs and threaten Europe’s industrial competitiveness.

raw.headline: Exxon CEO Warns EU’s CSDDD Would Cripple Business
raw.summary: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods has sharply criticized the EU’s Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive, warning it would impose unworkable costs and threaten Europe’s industrial competitiveness.

headline: Clariant Rejects Claim From BP, ExxonMobil That It Infringed EU Competition Law on Ethylene Market
summary: The chemical company rejected claims in lawsuits filed by BP and ExxonMobil that its purchases of ethylene infringed EU competition law.

raw.headline: Clariant Rejects Claim From BP, ExxonMobil That It Infringed EU Competition Law on Ethylene Market

headline: Clariant rejects allegations from BP Europe and ExxonMobil against four companies related to the 2020 competition law infringement
summary: AD HOC ANNOUNCEMENT PURSUANT TO ART. 53 LR Muttenz, 03 October 2025 Clariant, a sustainability-focused specialty chemical company, today announced that on 02 October 2025, the company received two claims for damages against four companies, including Clariant, from BP Europe SE and ExxonMobil Petroleum & Chemical B.V. with the court of Munich and Dortmund respectively, both in Germany. headline: Supermajors Slim Down to Protect Shareholder Payouts
summary: The world's largest oil and gas companies are accelerating layoffs and restructuring their workforces to cut costs and increase efficiency amid weaker oil prices and industry consolidation.

raw.headline: Supermajors Slim Down to Protect Shareholder Payouts
